data.reddit:
Terrified I have colon cancer. What started as constipation has turned into always feeling like I have to poop. Even after I go, it still feels bloated. The poops range from normal, mucky, and the dreaded pencil shapes (however I don’t get those all the time). 

My weight has been fluctuating between 141-144. I do not lift like I used to so I think that is attributing to that. However I *feel* skinnier and I’m scared potential cancer could be why. 

My diet isn’t great, I really just eat lots of fruit and drink black coffee and lots of water, but that’s not to say I eat other things as well. It’s not that I have no appetite, I just don’t eat at a lot if that makes any sense. 

My only saving grace that it is not cancer is that you should never self-diagnose and that there is no blood in my stool. Also, how cancer symptoms always overlap with other things, but I’m still not ruling it out.

I’m hopeful it’s IBS Due to my depression and now crippling health anxiety, but real life tells us that we are never safe from anything, so it is what it is.

I have a meeting with the GI on the 26th but honestly i dont know if I can wait that long. 

Any help would be appreciated. This whole thing has been a nightmare. 

————————

Age: 25 

Sex: M 

Height: 5'8 

Weight 142

Race: Caucasian 

Duration of complaint: 3+ weeks

Location on body: Lower and higher right side,  sometimes switches over the left but not always. Now gets a bit sensitive in abdomen but the right side of my belly button.

Any diagnosed medical issues: No 

Current medications and dose: None

Recreational drugs: Drinking

Smoking status: never
